091/**
092 *  A collection of SVG related utility methods and factory methods for SVG
093 *  elements.
094 *
095 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
096 *  @version $Id: SVGUtils.java 1074 2023-10-02 12:05:06Z tquadrat $
097 *  @since 0.0.5
098 *
099 *  @UMLGraph.link
100 */
101@SuppressWarnings( {"ClassWithTooManyMethods", "OverlyComplexClass", "OverlyCoupledClass"} )
102@UtilityClass
103@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: SVGUtils.java 1074 2023-10-02 12:05:06Z tquadrat $" )
104public final class SVGUtils
105{
106        /*-----------*\
107    ====** Constants **========================================================
108        \*-----------*/

1915     *      &quot;positive-angle&quot; direction, {@code false} for
1916     *      drawing it in a &quot;negative-angle&quot; direction.

2039    /**
2040     *  Clones the given element.<br>
2041     *  <br>The clone will be semantically identical to the given element (it
2042     *  looks the same in the final output), but it will not be of the same
2043     *  Java type.
2044     *
2045     *  @param  element The element to clone.
2046     *  @return The clone.
2047     */
2048    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
2049    public static final SVGElement cloneElement( final SVGElement element )
2050    {
2051        final var elementName = requireNonNullArgument( element, "element" ).getElementName();
2052        final var xmlElement = ((XMLElementAdapter) element);
2053        final var flags = xmlElement.getFlags().toArray( Flags[]::new );
2054        final var retValue = new SVGGenericElement( elementName, flags );
2055
2056        retValue.registerValidAttributes( xmlElement.retrieveValidAttributes().toArray( String []::new ) );
2057        retValue.registerValidChildren( xmlElement.retrieveValidChildren().toArray( String []::new ) );
2058
2059        element.getAttributes().forEach( retValue::setAttribute );
2060        element.getChildren().forEach( currentElement -> retValue.addChild( cloneElement( (SVGElement) currentElement ) ) );
2061        element.getNamespaces().forEach( retValue::setNamespace );
2062
2063        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2064        return retValue;
2065    }   //  cloneElement()
2066
2067    /**
2068     *  Creates an instance of the
2069     *  {@linkplain org.tquadrat.foundation.svg.type.SVGPathElement path element}
2070     *  {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.svg.type.SVGPathElement.SVGClosePath}
2071     *  that uses relative coordinates.
2072     *
2073     *  @return The new path element.
2074     */
2075    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
2076    public static final SVGPathElement closePath()
2077    {
2078        final var retValue = new SVGClosePath();
2079
2080        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2081        return retValue;
2082    }   //  closePath()

2201    /**
2202     *  Creates a generic SVG element.<br>
2203     *  <br>This method should be used to create an SVG element that does not
2204     *  have (yet) its specific implementation class. It does not work to
2205     *  introduce completely new, still unknown SVG elements, as it checks the
2206     *  given element name.<br>
2207     *  <br>The returned instance will also check which attributes are allowed
2208     *  for the element it represents as well as which children are allowed to
2209     *  it.
2210     *
2211     *  @param  elementName The name for the new element.
2212     *  @return The new generic SVG element.
2213     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException    The given element name does not
2214     *      denote a define SVG element.
2215     */
2216    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
2217    public static final SVGGenericElement createGenericElement( final String elementName )
2218    {
2219        if( retrieveElementCategory( elementName ).isEmpty() )
2220        {
2221            throw new IllegalArgumentException( format( "Unknown element name: %s", elementName ) );
2222        }
2223
2224        final var retValue = new SVGGenericElement( elementName );
2225
2226        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2227        return retValue;
2228    }   //  createGenericElement()
2229

2528
2529    /**
2530     *  Creates an SVG {@code <svg>} element instance.
2531     *
2532     *  @param  usage  How the new {@code <svg>} element should be used.
2533     *  @return The new {@code <svg>} element.
2534     */
2535    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
2536    public static final SVG createSVG( final Usage usage )
2537    {
2538        final var retValue = new SVGImpl();
2539
2540        switch( requireNonNullArgument( usage, "usage" ) )
2541        {
2542            case EMBED_HTML ->
2543            {
2544                retValue.setNamespace( createSVGNamespace( SVG_PREFIX ) );
2545                retValue.setNamespace( createXLINKNamespace() );
2546                retValue.setAttribute( SVGATTRIBUTE_BaseProfile, "full" );
2547                retValue.setAttribute( SVGATTRIBUTE_Version, "1.1" );
2548            }
2549
2550            case EMBED_HTML5 ->
2551            {
2552                retValue.setAttribute( SVGATTRIBUTE_BaseProfile, "full" );
2553                retValue.setAttribute( SVGATTRIBUTE_Version, "1.1" );
2554            }
2555
2556            case EMBED_SVG -> { /* Does nothing */ }
2557
2558            case STANDALONE_DOCUMENT ->
2559            {
2560                /*
2561                 * This configuration was taken more or less (more <i>less</i>)
2562                 * from an SVG document created with Inkscape.
2563                 */
2564                retValue.setNamespace( createSVGNamespace( SVG_PREFIX ) );
2565                retValue.setNamespace( createSVGNamespace( EMPTY_STRING ) );
2566                retValue.setNamespace( createXLINKNamespace() );
2567                retValue.setNamespace( createCCNamespace() );
2568                retValue.setNamespace( createRDFNamespace() );
2569                retValue.setAttribute( SVGATTRIBUTE_BaseProfile, "full" );
2570                retValue.setAttribute( SVGATTRIBUTE_Version, "1.1" );
2571            }
2572
2573            default -> throw new UnsupportedEnumError( usage );
2574        }
2575
2576        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2577        return retValue;
2578    }   //  createSVG()
2579
2580    /**
2581     *  Creates an SVG {@code <svg>} element instance and adds it to the given
2582     *  parent.
2583     *
2584     *  @param  parent  The parent for the new {@code <svg>} element.
2585     *  @return The new {@code <svg>} element.
2586     */
2587    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
2588    public static final SVG createSVG( final SVGElementWithChildren parent )
2589    {
2590        final var retValue = createSVG( EMBED_SVG );
2591        requireNonNullArgument( parent, "parent" ).addChild( retValue );
2592
2593        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2594        return retValue;
2595    }   //  createSVG()
2596

2603     */

2608

2610        return retValue;
2611    }   //  createSVGDocument()

2613    /**
2614     *  Creates the namespace instance that is used for all SVG stuff.
2615     *
2616     *  @param  prefix  The prefix; can be empty or {@code null}.
2617     *  @return The new namespace instance.
2618     */
2619    private static final Namespace createSVGNamespace( final String prefix )
2620    {
2621        final var identifier = URI.create( "http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" );
2622        final var retValue = isNotEmptyOrBlank( prefix ) ? new Namespace( prefix, identifier ) : new Namespace( identifier );
2623
2624        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2625        return retValue;
2626    }   //  createSVGNamespace()

2931    /**
2932     *  Creates an instance of the
2933     *  {@linkplain org.tquadrat.foundation.svg.type.SVGPathElement path element}
2934     *  {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.svg.type.SVGPathElement.SVGCubicCurveTo}
2935     *  that uses relative coordinates.
2936     *
2937     *  @param  x1   The x coordinate for the first control point.
2938     *  @param  y1   The y coordinate for the first control point.
